sub_title: Senior Merger & Acquisition Manager at A.P. Moller - Maersk
summary:
Passionate about logistics, people, projects and customers, bottom up or top down, simply love solving problems together with others. Practical and strategic thinker.
Proven track record in supply chain, operational excellence, digitalization, project management, change management and people leadership.

certifications.name: Professional Communication: Business Writing and Storytelling

profile_positions.description:
Project manager, Regional office, EUR region
- Day to day collaboration with regional and area leadership across customer experience, finance, product and shared service center functions
- Acting as project lead/coordinator or consultation specialist to achieve regional strategic objectives and targets
- Proactively reviewing organizational improvement options, business case management
- Supporting regional community work amongst others for customer satisfaction, continues improvement, customer experience leadership and learning & developement
- Various regional key priorities focal for workforce planning, financial health metrics, re-org matters
- Managing export regional control tower for global supply chain customers
profile_positions.title: Transformation and Customer Outcome / Regional Project Manager at A.P. Moller - Maersk

profile_positions.description: Responsible for building the destination flow element of a global supply chain management digital platform
profile_positions.title: Product Owner

profile_positions.description: Responsible for developing global logistics programs and supply chain solutions to support my organization and clients' strategic vision and growth. Responsible to deliver client's supply chain operational performance, implementation, execution and continuous improvement.
profile_positions.title: Global Program Director

profile_positions.description:
- Full responsibility of the Project team located in Willebroek warehouse
- Project manager for various projects, analyzing processes and creating business plan for each project
- Support and maintain WND EDI interfaces, including assistance to customers for improving EDI performance
- Full ownership of all support and maintenance for all WHS related applications
- Project management for WMS and operationally related applications
- Anchor for process excellence in a range of logistics and warehousing activities
- Support and maintenance WMS performance
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Damco, one of the world’s leading third party logistics providers, specialises in delivering customised freight forwarding and supply chain solutions. The company provides services in 300+ locations across 100+ countries and employs 11,000+ people. In 2015, Damco had a net turnover of USD 2.74 billion, managed 2.9 million TEU of ocean freight and supply chain management volumes, and air-freighted 180 thousand tonnes. Damco is part of the Maersk Group.

As Global OPEX Lead Navigator, responsible for an international project team of internal consultants and change agents with the objective to deploy sustainable LEAN transformation projects in Damco's largest operational offices (CSO's) globally.

Each transformation consists of a holistic 16-week on-site project, structured around 5 dimensions: Customer needs & insights, Process efficiency, Performance management, Organizational setup & skills, Mindset & behavior. In every 'project' we deploy LEAN tools and use the LEAN methodology to transform our CSO's bottom-up.

Responsibilities are:
- Project management
- People leadership & coaching
- Change management
- Stakeholder management
- Budget

Additional projects and responsibilities include:
1. Training of new global navigators and Continuous Improvement (CI) managers
2. Development and improvement of Damco OPEX project and training materials
3. Performing LEAN Maturity Assessments for transformed sites
profile_positions.title: Global OPEX Lead Navigator

profile_positions.description:
Implement Operational Excellence in the CSO’s, in close cooperation with the local organization and act as a change agent in order to develop and implement a systematic approach to continuous, sustainable improvement. 
•	Together with the local CSO organization, analyse the AS-IS in terms of customer satisfaction, process execution, mindset & behaviour, performance management and organization & skills
•	Execute the designed OPEX execution plan together with local management in order to reach the desired ‘to be’ state
•	Guide, train and coach the local organization to reach the desired ‘to be’ state, aiming towards a state of ‘continuous improvement’
•	Act as a true ambassador for the OPEX concept in the CSOs and explain the advantages and how to deliver a better service at a lower cost
•	Provide input for improvements in the design and ways of working of the OPEX tool kit
•	Train, coach and develop other, newly appointed navigators in the global pool
profile_positions.title: Global Operational Excellence Navigator

profile_positions.description:
- Drive the execution (timelines and value) of the continuous improvement project pipeline
- Support, train and coach the entire region in OPEX tools and techniques where needed
- Support the regional (including 5 countries) management in continuously improving the performance at all identified levels and metrics
- Share identified and implemented improvements with other region/center
- Implement identified improvement ideas from other regions/centers
- Implement & test suggested improvements / changes to the standard processes as defined by the global process owners
- Introduce end-to-end process mindset into the region (by understanding how the regional office is performing into the entire Damco network)
- Ensure that changes / updates / improvements to the initial training material are effectively cascaded through the entire region
profile_positions.title: Continuous Improvement Manager

profile_positions.description:
December 2013-: Member of Regional Simplification Project  
December 2011–: Customer Service Representative 
-Managing import and export FCL, FTL and SCM shipments for direct customers and A.P. Moller partners/offices
-Customer care for key & global accounts, middle and small companies in Hungary and neighbour countries
-Handling and coordinating customer inquiries in the area of ordering, demand forecasting, shipping, billing issues, and complaints
-Recognise, chart, solve and communicate issues/problems with customers and subcontractors
-Analyse service performance from logistics data, and customer feedbacks by working together closely with inside and outside sales representatives to meet the exact needs of new and current customers in form of day to day operations to client visits
-Maintain and update database regarding shipment moves, rates and finance details as KPIs require
-Optimise SOPs for key account customers and finance documentation 
-Support subcontractors (shipping lines, freight forwarders, trucking companies, port authorities, customs offices) for a better relationship
